chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court, in custody.  Atty Chaman appears by phone. Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Chapman states Judge Anderson released him from all of DEF's cases. Since Judge Harrington was not involved, Atty Chapman renews motion to withdraw on Judge Harrington's cases.
Court revews file. Court addresses DEF. DEF wishes to fire Atty Chapman. Court addresses DEF regarding waiving right to attorney by conduct. DEF is to go through process of getting new counsel. Atty Chapman is not released at this time.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 14, 2017 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Atty Chapman addressed the court moved to w/draw as DE states he wishes to fire Attorney Chapman.   Court addressed defendant.  DE states it will take 3 months to find an attorney.  Court Atty Chapman is released as attorney on all cases - Jury trial set for 8/17/17 is taken off - defendant advised he is to appear with an attorney.  Status conference will need to be set with Judge Harrington.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to time constraint of calendar matter is addressed prior to Atty Chapman calling in to appear.  OFF THE RECORD.   Atty Poquette states parties have reached an agreement.  Case 16CF64 is scheduled for a Plea/Sentencing on May 31st with Judge John Anderson.  Parties wish to have all DE's matters settled with a consolidated plea on that date.  Judge Harrington agrees,  Review set to ensure matters 15CF293 & 15CF125 are resolved, and if not will be reset in front of Judge Harrington.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addressed DE as to the motion for Atty Nelsen to be w/drawn as attorney.  Court grants motion Atty Nelsen is released as an Attorney.

Bruce Poquette appears for the state, DEF in court in custody with Atty Lance Nelsen, Courts calls Psychologist Rebecca Seifert by phone - sworn/testifies direct; cross  - court accepts report of doctor as an exhibit;  argument; parties cannot find in statutes where court must give a 2nd opinion in this matter.  Court finds DEF competent to proceed.    DEF counsel Motion to Withdraw court takes under advisement and will decide 4-8-16 1pm

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  all parties receieved report and Doctor found DEF competent to proceed, Atty Nelson is challenging the finding,  wants second evaluation and DEF wants new counsel,  court will not allow him to request new counsel when he says he is not competent.  Defendant Norman Price says in court and rejects finding of doctor and says he is not competent to proceed.  
 Court orders a second opinion for evaluation.
IN-PATIENT

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen by video from jail.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PLEAS is being postponed, Mr Price has not been administered his medication lately, DEF states his competency is being questioned and request he be re-assessed.   State agrees a report from Oct 2015 may be dated,  971.13 evaluation,  state requests inpatient evaluation as does DEF counsel.   Court orders Inpatient Evaluation at Mendota.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Norman Joseph Price in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Norman Joseph Price in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:58 AM Court calls case and recites appearances.  State makes stmt.  Atty Bachman requests a competency evaluation.  Defendant interrupts and states he does not want a competency evaluation.  Atty Bachman continues.  Defendant states NO he does not want a competency eval and requests he dismiss his attorney.  Court makes stmt.  Defendant makes further statement using the F word frequently.  State does not object to the motion.  Court: 971.14 of statutes - court makes stmt - court grants request on counsels request and what he has observed in the courtroom this morning - competency evaluation is ordered under WI statutes.   Atty Bachman makes stmt.  Court questions the state.  WI Forensics unit will assign someone after the Court signs an order for an evaluation.  will proceed from there.  State makes stmt.  defendant addressed the court.  Court makes stmt - will sign order for evaluation.  Defendant's Price makes stmt defendant has ADHD and is suppose to be on medication.  Atty Bachman makes further stmt.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
